text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Production in the Sarajevo region should reach 30 percent of the pre-war level by next year, Kemal Grbo, president of the Sarajevo Chamber of Commerce says at a traditional year end press conference.

- The vice-president of the Moslem-Croat federation Ejup Ganic will most probably remain in the post while Vladimir Soljic, a Croat and former defence minister of the federation, will become its new president, the daily quotes diplomatic sources as saying.

- Hasan Cengic, former deputy minister of defence in the Moslem-Croat federation who was forced to step down under U.S. pressure, is likely to be named minister of reconstruction and development, paper reports.
- Italian President Luigi Scalfaro meets Bosnian president Alija Izetbegovic in Sarajevo, promises continued commitment from Italy to help with Bosnia's reconstruction.
